ecb07fcf138d068db0b49c5783c91210 (17:24): do you guys think html5 will be able to replicate all that flash is/was?
9a92748ddfe5be4abb4946b858d5f577 (17:26): I hope it won't kill the processor and battery life like flash did ;)
1353d9b683d6d7b4281d762ca742bdb9 (17:29): ecb07fcf138d068db0b49c5783c91210, I can only speak for myself, but no.  It won't replicate.  It will do it better :)
ecb07fcf138d068db0b49c5783c91210 (17:30): i'm very new to web design/development.  I've seen the chrome experiments.  Do you think html5/javascript will be able to replace flash for games?
ecb07fcf138d068db0b49c5783c91210 (17:31): I haven't worked on websites since the 90's so I'm way behind the power curve
1353d9b683d6d7b4281d762ca742bdb9 (17:31): ecb07fcf138d068db0b49c5783c91210, not overnight, but some major announcements with html5+ chrome's native client came out yesterday

4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:56): for some companies it makes sense
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:56): basically every company that can get away with a NaCL port of their game
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:56): i dont see NaCl as an authoring platform, but a compilation target
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:57): http://i.imgur.com/v2ilG.jpg
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:57): from what i can see perf in a webgl cant match nacl just yet
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:57): bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8: what i really want to see is Unity work on a webgl target
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (17:58): that'd be a huge success

bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:59): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: That would be terrif.  Though right now, I feel like pushing NaCL is going to prevent gaming companies from ever shifting to WebGL (or CSS, for that matter).  Ugh.  Nobody even even NaCL except for Google.  It's creating a rift where there need be none.
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (17:59): Aren't NaCl games Chrome Apps/xtensions?
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (17:59): a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d: Not strictly speaking, but essentially yes
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (18:00): a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d: It's more like Flash 2.0, IMHO
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (18:00): but they sure arent websites?

a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (18:00): or embeddable in websites?

a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (18:07): And I don't think IE10 would like to be left behind on the WebGL party wagon
